Dr# Skomia
November 17, 1959

Is to be a study of audience, a sociologist is needed# None of these, of
course, are completely independent but I believe the point is clear# The
members of the consolttee or team could not do all of the consulting but
they would obtain others whenever necessary# Another possibility would be
to set up regional teams# A team of consultants representing each
discipline in the southwest, one in the northwest, one in the midwest,
one in the southeast, and one in the northeast. This would certainly cut
down transportation costs#
X am at a complete loss to estimate the budget needed. This would depend
completely on the number of requests for consulting help and the distance
from the home of each consultant to the location, when travel to the loca¬
tion is necessary# Do not think that it is always# I think that consultants
should be paid a minimum of expenses and $50.00 per day# I guess that I
would hit the foundation or government for $100,000 for the first year on
a trial basis and then see how it goes. I could handle some of these con¬
tacts if you wish, though it might be better if you and 1 did it together,
Harry.
I am in favor of the three year rotation basis for committee membership.
Without such rotation, we run the risk of growing stale because of the lack
of fresh ideas being fed into the hopper.
I do not know whether the above is what you wanted, Harry. Here it is for
whatever it may be worth.
Sincerely,
Samuel L. Becker
Chairman, NAEB
Research Committee
